1.content:
"I guess you don't remember much of what happened" You read from the worn pages. "Let me refresh you. You were moving out of your parents house during the summer time..."

"Don't forget to call when you're all settled in!"

"I won't, mom!" you respond as you pull out of the driveway.

You were on your way to your new place with a trunk full of your stuff and some "Home essentials" from your mother. This was the last haul after getting the furniture inside and you couldn't wait to be all finished moving in.
After an hour or so after you arrived at your new house, you were done, and you decided to relax for the evening.

"Home sweet home" you say to yourself.

It wasn't a large house, but it had more than enough space in your opinion, and even more importantly, it was affordable. You practically stole the place.
You sat down on your couch and watched a little t.v. and soon after the power went out.

"Perfect" you grumble, annoyed.

You head down to the basement to look for the fuse box, grabbing a flashlight beforehand. It only takes a few moments to find it and soon after the power flashes back on, but you noticed something different from before. It was a book, sitting in the corner...

"Hey!" a familiar voice calls and you snap back to reality. You were with someone.

Who was it again?
1.title: And so it begins...

11.content:
"Hey! Watch it!"

"Oh, sorry Maya... I was just thinking"

"Well could you think AFTER you get off of my tail!?"

"Crap! Sorry!" you say as you move your foot.

"Ow ow ow.... that hurt, (*your name*)" she says now holding her tail.

"My bad"

"It's fine, at least we're almost there" she says "What were you thinking about anyways?"

"Just about how we met a few months ago"

"Really? Like how you fell out of the sky and landed on me?"

"Not my fault"

"I still blame you" she says jokingly

"Thanks by the way" you say

"For what?"

"Believing me. Most people would have called me crazy if I told them that I came from a different world"

"You should know by now that I'm not most people, (*your name*)."

"No, you're much prettier" you say "and you make a great landing pad" you add jokingly.

"How sweet" she says sarcastically

"How much farther?" you ask

"Just over this ridge" she says "You remember what we're here for right?"

"Of course. We're looking for the.... uh..."
11.title: Maya, your Cat-saith companion

113.content:
"We're looking for those thieves, right? the guys who robbed the jewelry shop"

"Yeah" Maya responds "It should be easy too, the guy who put up the reward on the job board said that they were just local thugs. So they shouldn't put up too much of a fight."

"and at 4,000 Gen, it's easy money." you say

You and Maya needed the money, rent was almost due and 4,000 Gen would be more than enough to get you through the month.

"So far so good" says Maya. As you move over the edge of the ridge, you and Maya notice a small camp with a few people sitting around a fire.

"That must be them" you say

"Looks like things are looking up" says Maya "This'll be even easier than I thought"

Suddenly, you hear a noise behind you. You turn quickly to see tip of a sword pointed towards you.

"Don't ya Move" Says the thug "Unless you wanna get all cut up, boy"

"(*Your Name*)!" Maya calls as she sees the thief

"You stay put too, little cat!" he says

You think for a moment about what you should do.
113.title: Jewel thieves

choices: Let her go, no point in it now.
You try to take the sack.
1133.content:
"Now get up!" says the thief "Nice an' slow like"

"Easy, huh?" you say sarcastically to Maya

Maya doesn't seem to notice you, instead her ears perk up and she seems to notice something.

"What is it?" you ask

Suddenly, the thief standing in front of you falls to the ground and behind his fallen corpse is someone that you really didn't want to see.

"Oh, it's you two" she says

"What are you doing here, Dark?" you ask

"My job" she says, you also notice that she has a sack of some kind over her shoulder.

"What is that?" Maya asks

"About 4,000 Gen worth of jewelry" she replies "I'll be on my way now"

"What!? that was our job!" you say "We came to deal with the thieves!"

"Then you should have been quicker about it" Dark says "they've already been dealt with"

"That's no fair!" says Maya

"If you have a problem, then take the jewels from me" she says as she holds the sack out in front of her.

Now she was practically mocking you at this point, everyone knew that Dark was a vampire and trying to fight her would almost guarantee failure. If it were the day time it would be different but dusk had already fallen, and she was not about to part from her prize so easily.
You knew that you would not win.

"That's what I thought" Dark says

Well... what now?
1133.title: Not her...

choices: You get the bag (She lets you go)
11333.content:
You don't know what came over you, but you knew that without that reward, you and Maya wouldn't be able to eat for a while.
Personally you prefer to eat on a regular basis and you're pretty sure Maya does too.

As soon as Dark turns her back, you charge at her.
Honestly, she believed that you had given up on the reward after what had just happened so even she was caught a little off guard.
You grab for the sack and...
11333.title: I'm going for it.

113332.content:
almost as soon as you grab for the bag, Dark turns and dodges you.

"Damnit, Dark! we need that bag." you say

"So do I" she says

You go for the bag again but this time, Dark delivers a roundhouse kick to your side, sending you flyin about 15 feet to the side causing yo to land with a crunching noise.

"(*Name*)!" Calls Maya as she runs to your side "You're hurt"

"I'll be fine" you respond.

As you try to stand up you feel an incredible pain and caugh up some blood.

"Okay, maybe not..." you say

"Lets get back to town, (*Name*). we can have Victoria look at you"

"Smartest thing you've done all day" says Dark in a callous tone

Maya looked about ready to tear her head off, the only thing stopping her from trying however, was your injuries. Dark left thereafter and Maya reached into her pouch for a gate stone. You normally didn't use gate stones because of how expensive they were but maya thought this was enough of an emergency.

She tossed the stone into the air and a blue portal appeared in front of you.

"Lets go" she said as she helps you to walk through the portal.

Where did the gate stone lead you?
113332.title: oops...

choices: Move in quietly for a closer look.
The group notices you and Maya
114.content:
"Something to do with an enchanted bracelet, right?" you ask

"Yeah" Maya responds "We need to retrieve it from a nearby ruin for the client. He's willing to pay big for it too."

"Good to hear" you say "We need the money"

"I'm so excited! I'm going to eat so much tonight!" says Maya, quite entheusiastically.

"Don't forget, Maya. We need to pay rent before we start spending all of our money on food. We're already behind on our payments and we could get evicted if we're not careful."

" *Sigh* Fine..."

You and maya had been travelling for a good two days now to get to the ruin. Thankfully it had been decently sunny all week, which made travel by foot much easier.

"We should be getting close now" says Maya "Keep your eyes open for the ruin"

"Right"

You and Maya continue to walk until you notice what appears to be part of a large stone fort that was now tipped over and left mostly buried.

You also notice something else...

"Get down!" says Maya in a loud whisper as she pushes you onto the ground, nearly slamming your head into it.

"What is it?" you ask. Maya points near the ruin with her finger at a small group of moving figures.

"What do you think it is?" You ask.

"I don't know... But I don't like it."

They appear to be moving things from a wagon into the ruin.
114.title: Enchanted bracelet

choices: "for us do destroy this place; it's cursed."
"to help us find the medallion. We'll get paid big.
1141.content:
As soon as you see the figures, you realize that they are members of your opposing guild, Harbinger.

         "Maya, it's the Harbinger Guild!" you whisper.

         "What!?" she replies. "What are they doing here?"

         "I'm not sure; hmm, let's get closer, see what they're up to this time."

         Doing your best to crawl around rocks and bushes, whatever can makes things easier to spy on them, so far being successful. Hiding behind a huge boulder, you're able to see, something anyway, what they're bringing down into the ruin. Crates.

         "What do you suppose is in those?" Maya asks

         "Not sure, but I don't think it's anything good, for us anyway." You see what seems to be the leader, a Minotaur.

         "What's in those crates, exactly?" asks a probable lesser person.

         "Nothing to worry your head, just supplies--"
1141.title: Race against guilds or destruction..?

choices: See what's in the crates before you head in.
Too risky to check. Get inside before you're noticed.
11413.content:
"What are they saying, Maya?" you ask

"They're here for a medallion of some kind... They say it's worth allot."

"Good thing they're not after the bracelet. That'd make it a bit harder." you think about why they might want this medallion, and why at the same time as you're looking for a bracelet...

"Maybe it's a matching set?" you say puzzled.

Maya seems to get a little excited about this possible connection.

"That means we could turn in both items for more money!" she says in a loud whisper, barely able to contain herself. "I'll be able to eat my fill AND we get to pay rent. This is the best"

You think about it for a sec, watching the guard movement patterns closely to avoid getting noticed.

"Try not to get too excited, Maya. We're only getting payed to recover the bracelet. We don't know if the medallion is even connected at all to what we're looking for."

Maya's ears drop as she rethinks it all. Almost frowning.

"Just don't try to do anything that could get you caught is all. Harbinger is dangerous."

"I know... I know..."

"You're still going to try. Aren't you?" you say

"...maybe..."

Great, you think to yourself

You're now getting closer to the ruins edge and nobody seems to have noticed you so far...
11413.title: A medallion too?

choices: "there is also another secret passageway right around here."
114132.content:
You had the idea to check what's inside the crates, but decide not to as to that would be way too risky. Shaking your head in disapproval, you head inside the ruin, ironically, not in shambles at all. Except for specks of rocks here and there and the hole in the wall for the entrance, it was basically clean throughout, which makes you suspicious of why, but you decide to drop that for now.

         Hiding behind a piece of wall, not before grabbing a conveniently placed torch, you take out a map that also had the letter of the client and where the bracelet was.

         "Well, now what?" Maya asks. "Aren't we supposed to be getting further in?"

         "We should, but if only we can get past those guards." With swords in hand, you see two guards, circling back and forth at another doorway leading to a stairway that goes down. Reading the map, and heading back and forth to the letter, you finalize a route possible to get inside, but what bugged you was this:

         You noticed a splotch of ink just after the end of the letter. Reading closer, you realize it's a really fine print.

         "Maya, look at this." She comes over and sees the basic microscopic letters on the parchment. "Think you can read that?"

         "I'll try." You hear her mumbling while also checking back to make sure you won't get spotted. "I got it!"

         "What does it say?"

         "Well--"
114132.title: Now what..?

1141322.content:
"What?" you ask "Are you serious?"

Maya is now once again excited.

"Yay!" she exclaims quietly "Now we really can get paid more!"

you sigh at this.

"Actually, Maya. This is bad. Very bad."

"What do you mean?"

"Now we have multiple problems. For starters, now we have to try to get the necklace before, or from, Harbinger."

You look over Maya's shoulder quickly to see if the guards have noticed you. Thankfully they hadn't but one of the guards seems to leave to do something else, leaving the other alone.

"Second, our client was trying to swindle us out of our payment. Remember the rules?"

"Yeah, yeah... Guild rules require that all parts of the contract are to be fulfilled, unless otherwise specified by the client themselves in writing..." she says, groaning.

"So if we didn't get both pieces for this guy, then we weren't getting payed. At all. He tried to hide this part from us so he could get some free workers." you say, getting continuously mad and nervous about this "And even if we did find that part of the contract, the price for completion was already set."

"So?" said Maya, not really sure about what you're getting at for the last reason.

"So, even if we got both items for the client, we're only getting payed a decent amount for one item. We'd do all he work and get only half of the works worth of pay."

"So... No gigantic dinner?"

"Not if we want to keep our house, no."

Maya simply drops her head for a moment. You look at her for a moment to see if she was alright, but she seems to get really mad about what you just explained, growling even. She stands up, turns around, and roundhouse kicks the lone guard standing at the door before he has an idea of what just happened.

"Remind me not to get on your bad side." you say

"Already there, [Name]" she says, now in a VERY bad mood. "Let's get this guys trinkets and get out."

"Fair enough. Lets go"

You open the door into the next room...
1141322.title: "the medallion comes WITH the bracelet!"

11413222.content:
You unsheathe your sword and dagger and get ready to face a mob of people. But to your surprise, no one was there... and both objects were right there on a pedestal.

         "Where is everybody?" you ask to no one specifically, that is, until you see Maya take Gen from the guy she just knocked out. "Seriously?"

         "Ugh, fine." She gives back probably only half of the guys money. "Happy?"

         "Very. A down payment is nice though. How much did you take?"

         "I don't know, like 80 Gen? I really wasn't counting. You'd think for a quest, he'd leave this back home. Let's just get the jewelry and see if this guy is playing us."

         Grabbing the set of enchanted items, you run towards the exit, luckily not alarming anyone from the other guild. Going to the direction where yours is, you slow to a stop and see the guy, but he looks really shady for some reason.

         "Ah, hello, there," he greets, sounding really English for some reason. "I assume you have what I asked for?"

         "Why yes." You give him the enchanted items. "Thank you, sir. Now, here you go."

         His payment was...
11413222.title: For an expedition, it sure is small...

choices: Not really... What do you want to do?
114132221.content:
"Lets see..." you say to yourself as you count out the golden coins " 1...2...3 thousand Gen. Alright, that's all of it"

"Here's a tip as well" says the shady gentleman

"Really?" asked one excited Maya

"Indeed" he says as he hands you a small scroll. Nothing really fancy about it, just a red ribbon tied to it in a bow.

"uh... thanks?" she says

"Oh, you're quite welcome" he says with a quiet chuckle at the end.

Soon after, the man walks off somewhere to do who knows what, and you are left alone with Maya as you walk the streets.

"Okay, this should be more than enough to cover what we owe on the house for the month." you say, holding the bag of Coin

"How much will we have left over?" asked Maya

You think about it for a moment as you redo the calculations again...

"Not much, probably... 200 Gen."

"Awe..."

"At least we can eat until the next job comes up"

"Yeah... Hey, wait!" she says as she grabs for a pouch on her belt. "How about we treat ourselves tonight?" she says, holding the near 80 Gen that she lifted earlier.

It would be nice to relax just a little before the next job. You'd also have enough to survive from the 200 Gen you'd have left over. It's really just been small paying odd jobs for you and Maya for over a month now. This last one at least deserves a break.

"Sure, why not?" you answer

"Yay!"

"Did you have anything you wanted to do in particular?"

"Well..."
114132221.title: Nice tip...

choices: Meet back with your last client
1141322212.content:
"... hmm, not really," Maya said. "Sure, eating out sounds nice, but I think we can wait until we get a bit more saved up."

         "Good point." Your eyes dart off to the scroll, wondering what is inside exactly. Opening it, you see a map with a few circles and "X"'s around the general area of the Guild and a letter attached. Another one..?

         Your companion takes notice and eyes the map. "What's with all the markings?"

         "I'm not sure..." Looking at the letter, it read:
"I'm sorry for the anonymity of my appearance, but if anyone I knew were to know that I have lost these items, I would seriously get it. Consider yourself lucky you're still young. But anyway, more to the point, this map is filled with a few dungeons and ruins chock full of Gen. Those that are circled are easy to get, but if you are to go to the crossed out ones, be wary. They could either be empty, trapped, or claimed. And also, if you heard anything from the Harbinger Guild, it was a crook trying to rip off. He's been after my stuff for so long, he even retorted to that. I apologize for any inconvenience. Hopefully this makes up for it.

P.S: If you'd like another quest, send me a message to the following address. Just show the front table the ribbon; they'll know who I am."


         "Huh. Why not? Well, what do you think we should do? There's still plenty of daylight left. Should we check this out or go back to the guy?"

         "Maybe after lunch, I'm starving here."

         "Yeah, alright."
1141322212.title: Maybe work on this quest?

choices: Goblin bandits wanted dead ~3000 Gen reward
Bodyguards wanted for local spice merchant ~700 Gen a day
"Well, you may be able to help me, actually." he says
13.content:
"Watch out!" you hear her scream

"Huh, what?" you say as something quickly and tightly grabs your ankle. A quick jerking motion yanks you off of the ground and into the air, causing you to hit your head on the ground before completely hanging you by your leg with a ringing noise in your ears.

"Wh-What was that!?" you ask, kind of befuddled by what just happened.

"I did tell you to watch out, [Your Name]." replies your Elven companion.

"I didn't see it ther-"

"That's why it's called a trap." she retorts, interupting you. "If it was an ambush, you'd be in quite a bit of trouble. This just appears to be a hunting snare." she says, examening the rope and piton used to hold it to the ground from over the tree.

"Lucky me." you say, still hanging upside down with the feeling of your head expanding due to all of the bloodflow now rushing to your ringing head.

"Can you help me down now, please?"

"Sure..." she says, drawing her dagger.

"No no, wait!!!" you say, but it was too late. With a single swipethe rope was cut, and you were on e again on terra firma, but still somewhat upside down. The landing didn't exactly help with your headache either...

"ouch..." you say, getting to your feet with a stumble.

"You're welcome." she says with a smile "Next time you go daydreaming, don't do it on a hunt."

"Point taken."

"Ready to keep going? Or are Humans just of a weak constitution?" she says

"Are you seriously trash-talking me right now?"

"How was it?"

"Not as bad as the last one..."

Which was true, her last attempt at trash-talking went something along the lines of 'You move with the grace of a pregnant yak with no hoofs'...

A couple of hours later, you and Lin'ora were back in town at the local trapper's hut, skinning the hares that you and her caught that morning.

"You never get used to the smell do you?" you ask. Watching it wasn't too hard of a task, but the smell was just awful.

"I have."

"It was a rhetorical question, Lin"

"I'm unfamiliar with the term." she says, now wiping her hands clean from the process of carving rabbits.

"It means a question that's not supposed to be answered." you say back. Sometimes, you forget that she's not human and how alien this world is to you.
A compliment from your kind could get yourself killed by many races here and you haven't even seen a tenth of them yet.

"That's... an interesting concept." she says after thinking about the words to say.

"So, we have food for the time being. Maybe we ahould see what they have for quests at the guild?" you suggest.

"Good idea."

You and Lin'ora head to the guild hall, which wasn't too far from where you were, and head to the jobs desk.

"Hey, Berk. How's it going?" you ask

"Surviving." he says, obviously tired from handling all of the job orders. You always found it easier to talk to Berk, since he was also human. "What can I help you with?" je asks as he scratches his beard.

"We were wondering if you had any jobs opened."

"Well... Let's see."
13.title: The Huntress

choices: Let him pick on you, standing up for yourself only means you'll get suspended.
14.content:
You almost jump out of your skin at the sound of a large crash, you turn around to see a giant of a man had just hit his head on a beam above him and fallen over.

"Damn, sometimes I wish I wasn't so tall." he groaned.

This is all so sudden for you, that you just stand there and stare, unable to comprehend what's going on.

"You, boy! You're late for your training." Stated the giant man.

"Me? Are you sure you have the right person? And why are you in my house?"
"Boy, have you lost your mind?"

"I-um-uh"

The man grabs you and throws you over his shoulder, and proceeds to carry you downstairs.
The first thing you notice is that everything looks newer, and more, medieval. You must be dreaming, this is completely crazy. After a few minutes the man carries you outside and sits you down.

"You must've hit your 'ed pretty hard, follow my finger with your eyes, lad." says the man

You do what he says in hopes of keeping your own sanity, maybe you just hit your head and he's right.

"Seems all fine to me, perhaps you got better, do you know my name, lad?" The man asked.

"Um... John?" you guess blatantly

"You've known me for years now! I'm Bro-"

"Brody! I was just going to say that"

Brody looks at you suspiciously
"I see, well then, we're burning daylight, back to training." Said Brody.

You begin to wonder what "training" means, until about 20 seconds later, when he starts pulling out weapons.

"Brody, I was hit on the head pretty hard, I don't remember how to do any of this." You lied.

"Maybe I should have gone easier on you during sparring practice... If you were hit that hard, maybe we shouldn't practice today, go home, lad." Brody responded.

"Home? Where do I live?" you ask

"Why, in the guild hall of course! Don't tell me you already forgot, boy!"

"Oh, of course, and where would that be?"

"You know what, I'll just walk you there."

As Brody and you walk to the Guild hall, you notice that the streets are totally different to you, almost like you were looking at a fairytail. when you get to the guild hall you look inside and see some familiar faces, you think you know them somehow but you're not sure how they seem familiar to you... You must have been here before you think.

All of a sudden you're in bed, it must have just been a dream after all, you look at your alarm clock, and it's 5:55 A.M., five minutes before you usually wake up. You decide to get out of bed and get ready for school.

"That was... Strange" you say to yourself.

You wish you could go back to sleep and continue the dream, but you have a test today, and need to go to school. You manage to get everything together efficiently because of how awake you feel, and catch a ride to school on the bus. The day seems to be going well until Lance starts to pick on you, again.

"Hey, (*Name*). Did you get that worksheet done for me today? Or are we gonna have a problem?"

What an asshole, you think to yourself

He does this every day, and every time it seems to get worse, last time you had to tell your mother you tripped to explain the bruising on your face. For the first time in your life you're actually thinking about standing up for yourself, but that would be insane, he's twice your size! Or.... Would it?
14.title: Brody, your friend and trainer

choices: Someone Walks in on you & Mr. Foley
You try to explain what happened
141.content:
"You know what?" you say as you start to stand up from your seat. "I do have a problem, can you guess what it is, asshole?" you say boldly

Lance just kinda looks at you for a second, dumbfounded by how you were talking to him.

"I'll give you a hint. He's got blonde hair, walks like an oaf and smells of his own stupidity. Do I paint a clear enough picture?"

at this point, Lance is practically steaming at the ears and as red as a lobster.

"You're gonna regret that one, you little shit!!!" he yells as he throws a punch at you as fast as he could.

Truth be told, you didn't really plan on what to do after you mouthed off the school bully, but somehow, you manage to not only move your head out of the way of what could be compared to a swinging gorilla but you also caught him in the gut with your own right jab.

there is a silence in the room for a few minutes, and now it looks like everyone in the room was watching what had happened.

Lance gasped loudly as you managed to knock the wind right out of him and he then falls to the floor.

"Did you see that?"
"Look what he did to him!"
"Where did he learn to do that?"

You hear the mumbled voices of your classmates as they look at you.
How did I do that? you think to yourself.

You hear a voice over the crowd

"(*Name*)! To my office, Now." said the principle

"Crap" you say under your breath

Soon after, you were in the office, being scolded by Mr. Foley

"What did you think you were doing, young man?"

"I... I don't actually know, sir."

What happens?
141.title: Stand up for yourself.

choices: The girl wants to talk to you
1411.content:
You sit through about 15 more minutes of scolding and suddenly, one of the teachers walks into the room.

"Mr. Foley."

"Yes? What is it?"

"One of the students wants to know if she can speak to you and (*Name*)."

Mr. Foley thinks about it for a few moments.

"Fine, send her in." he says

Finally a friendly face. You recognize her from your class, you think her name is Serah.

"What is it you need?" asked the principle

"Mr. Foley, why is (*Name*) in trouble?" asked the young girl

"For hurting another student, didn't you see what happened?"

"Yes, sir, I did" she says "But (*Name*) was only defending himself! Lance threw the first punch, right after threatening him."

You couldn't believe it, you didn't even know this girl that well and now she's defending you after punching someone.

"Is this true?" asked Mr.Foley

"Yes, sir." you respond matter-of-factly

"Alright... I'll let you go, this time, but if you're involved in something like this again, you'll be suspended on the spot. Am I clear on that?"

You happily give a nod and leave the office.

Just after, you hear the principal's assistant call Lance into the room and you head back to class.
1411.title: He lets you go, with a warning.

14113.content:
Okay, today has just been getting weirder and weirder.

First, you have a strange dream, like REALLY strange, that seems to be incredibly real.
Next, you're able to stand up to the school bully AND knock him to the floor in about 1.32 seconds.
Then, a girl that you barely even know, comes into the principle's office and defends you for doing so...

Just what is going on! Nothing like this ever happens to you!

You try to think about what may be causing things to be different... Come to think of it, weird things have been happening more frequently ever since you moved into your new house... ever since you found that book and.... why don't I remember reading it? I know I did, but....

Okay, now you were on to something. What was with that book?

After school, you head straight home and start to search for that book.

"Where did I put that thing?" you ask yourself, frustrated.

After about an hour of searching, you give up and just sit in your chair and feel really tired.

"I'll just take a nap." you say to yourself

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

"Wake up!" you hear

This wakes you up quickly, you sit straight up and look around. You're in that dream world again!?

"No... this is different" you say to yourself

It was the same dream but... you were somewhere else.

"You collapsed outside of the hall, (*Name*). Are you alright?" says a familiar voice

Who was it?
14113.title: After school

141132.content:
You look to see a girl standing next to you. She was short and had cat-ears and a tail! But she still looked familiar.
Just what is happening?!?!? you think to yourself

"Are you alright, (*Name*)?"

"I know you... I think" you say

"What do you mean? Why wouldn't you know me?"

You look around to see that you're in bed again but in a different building.

"Where am I?" you ask "And who are you?"

"You're in your room, at the guild hall... You really don't remember... Do you?"

The girl looks worried by you not knowing who she was.

"It's me; Maya" she says "Brody carried you in after you collapsed outside. That hasn't happened in months."

"I've collapsed before?" you ask, confused.

"Yeah, but only a couple of times and not in a while" she responds

You sit up as another figure walks through the door, only to receive a nasty headache. She wore some sort of robe and has black hair and purple eyes.... Wait. Purple eyes!?!?

"Looks like he's awakened" She says, although, she said it pretty quietly. Almost as if she were talking to herself.

"I think something may be wrong, Victoria" says Maya

"How do you mean?" Responds Victoria

"He doesn't seem to remember me, or anything really"

Victoria looks at you quizzically, walks over to you and stands over the bed.

"Do you know who I am?" she asks

"You're name is Victoria... right?" you say. Although, her name was obvious since Maya had already said it.

"Yes, but... do you know who I am?"

"Sorry, No"

"What was the last thing you remember doing?" she asks

"Well... I was going to school, and had gotten off of the bus... And then that guy Lanc-"

"Wait. A bus?" asked Maya

"A form of transportation, much like a wagon but doesn't require horses. (*Name*) has spoken of these before, when I would ask about where he came from." says Victoria

"I have?" You ask

Victoria reaches for a book from some sort of satchel, as well as what looks to be some vials with different colored liquids inside.

"I have a spell that could recover some of his memories, but I'm not sure how well it will work"

A spell? like magic? She must be crazy... You must be crazy! What kind of a person dreams up a world like this?!?

"Now, sit back and relax (*Name*)."

"Wait Wait Wait!" you say "Just what is going on here?!? Why are you trying to cast a spell?!? Why am I here? What is happening to me!?!?"

"Calm down, boy!" yells Brody, who apparently heard the commotion from outside of the room.

"Vic' is just here to help, like always"

You don't know who any of these people are, but they seem to know you. Should you trust them with doing something like a spell that does who-knows what? The more you thought about it, the more it made your head hurt. It made you wish that this was just a bad dream and that you would wake up in your chair, in the real world... But you're not sure what is real anymore.

"Please, (*Name*). Let us help." says Maya
141132.title: Wait... I know you.

15.content: No, it wasn't them, then who?
15.title: Who else?

info.brief_description: You are a member of the Guild known as Pantheon. What quests will you undertake?
info.description:
You find yourself in a brand new world, Known as Aureus, but how and why?
You end up joining into Pantheon, a questing guild, in order to survive this foreign place.

These are the rules for the story.

>The main character is known as (*Your Name*), yes, you! However, this story is designed to have a male lead, but if you are not male or if you simply don't want to use your name, just imagine another character to take his place.

>The main character must be involved with the Pantheon guild somehow

>Avoid killing any of the main characters.

>No adding any non-original characters. I don't want to see Naruto or Sailor Moon in this story. Ever.

>This is a romance story as well as adventure, it is not an erotica.

>Try to make chapters at least a couple of paragraphs long and keep it interesting.

>I'm not asking for perfect grammar (I have some issues sometimes) but try to keep it as neat as you can. And if it becomes a chore to try and understand what you have added, it will more than likely be edited or deleted.

>Keep the story going!!! no adding chapters that will end the story.

>Plenty of creatures exist in Aureus that don't in the real-world, such as orcs, trolls, vampires, Giant bugs and pretty much anything you can think up as long as it fits!

Alright that's enough rules. Onto the characters!

>Maya. she was the first person that you met in Aureus. She is a Cat-Saith, a race of humanoids that look mostly human but have feline features, such as a tail and ears as well as slit eyes, claws and fangs. Maya has short orange fur and short hair on her head and yellow eyes. She prefers to use martial arts while fighting and uses her claws while doing so to increase fighting capabilities. She stands at only 5'6" (which is actually within normal range for a Cat-Saith), is 19 years old and likes to wear cloths that aren't too restricting (She finds them really uncomfortable), usually a sleeveless vest and shorts. She became a member of Pantheon at the same time you did and you have always watched eachother's backs, even if you don't always agree on everything.

>Victoria Unaatis. Victoria is a human mage, she prefers protective and healing magic and has been a member of Pantheon for about 6 months. She is kinda shy and prefers to keep to herself but has helped you in the past with some quests when a healer was needed. She is 22 years old and stands at about 5'10". She usually wears her study robes but will wear an enchanted robe while questing for greater protection. She has straight Black hair that hangs at mid-shoulder, as well as light purple eyes, which is a trait of her family. She prefers reading her grimoires and practicing her magic over most activities but is more than willing to help others when she is needed. She also finds the story that you came from another world very interesting and will sometimes ask questions about it.

>Lin'ora. She is an Elf Huntress, she prefers the bow as her main weapon but always keeps her dagger ready.
She wears leather leggings and a leather vest as well as a long sleeved silk shirt. She has long blonde hair, green eyes, and long pointed ears (Tolkien Ears, not WoW style). She stands at 5'11" tall, No-one really knows how old she is (Elves can live to be about 4000 years old) but she looks like she is in her mid-20s, and usually only takes quests involving either monsters that need killing, or ones that involve treasure. She has been a member of Pantheon for just over a year now and has a reputation in the guild for her beauty and skills with a bow, but she doesn't really care for the recognition.
She has been on probably 3-4 quests with you and you have befriended her in the process, however, she still has a difficult time believing that you came from a different world.

>Brody. Brody has been a member of the Pantheon guild for over 15 years now and seldom goes on quests anymore,but he is more than happy to train the other guild members. Brody stands at a massive 6'7" tall and has unkempt black hair and a beard, he is 37 years old and carries a greatsword on his back. Oh, and by the way, he's a werewolf. When transformed, Brody stands at about 7'5" tall and grows black fur all over his body as well as a tail, claws, fangs and the head of a wolf. He can transform any time he wishes but prefers to do so only when necessary, such as losing his sword or becoming greatly injured.
(Courtesy of Isyther)

>Dark. No-one knows what her real name is, for all they know it actually could be Dark.
Dark is a vampire, a really powerful one too, but she believes that her vampirism is a curse and she herself hates vampires.
Normally she cannot walk in sunlight, but she can drink a special tea brewed specifically for her from a friend in the guild.
With it, she can walk in sunlight safely and become immune to weapons and items made from silver, but it will also suppress her abilities and render her as if she were human. She cannot be harmed by items such as crosses, running water or garlic (however, she doesn't personally like the taste). Dark stands at 5'11" tall, looks like she is in her mid 20s and has short black hair and red eyes. Dark normally quests alone, and uses her twin longswords with her inhuman speed and strength. No-one really knows when she arrived at Pantheon, but some say she has been there for over 500 years. She also has a tendency to be uncaring for other people and is a borderline sadist, which makes you wonder why she isn't a member of Harbinger.
(Also courtesy of Isyther)

>Silus. This young warrior is a former member of Harbinger, now recently turned to Pantheon.
Silus has blue eyes, short brown hair and stands at 6'1". He carries his Mace and shield on his back whenever he goes questing and doesn't feel comfortable outside of the cities without them. He doesn't wear much in terms of armor, just an old Breastplate and helmet that he got from his father when he was 15 years old, he is now 19 and takes care of his twin sister Serena. You don't know him too well personally, but he seems to worry about others often.

all of these characters are part of the Pantheon Guild and now so are you!
The guild is a way for members to find jobs that people need done that vary from the mundane to the extremely deadly.
there are probably 80 or so members currently enlisted to Pantheon many of which have made decent names for themselves through questing. There are however other guilds, some of which will take the same job as another guild and they would fight it out to see who gets the reward and sometimes they will take quests contradicting to yours (Such as, they would steal a diamond for someone, while your job is to guard it). The guild that has caused the most problems for Pantheon would be the Harbinger Guild. Most of the quests that Harbinger would take are mercenary jobs or assassination targets, Pantheon doesn't allow for assassination quests but will sometimes allow for mercenary quests, depending on the circumstances.

This is my first Interactive Story, reviews and suggestions would be helpful and very much appreciated.

>UPDATE: the beginning of the story has been redone, to allow for the companionship of different characters rather than having to travel with Maya automatically (Nov/15th/2013)

>UPDATE: The official currency in this world is known as Gen (Sounds more like genn than Jenn). Gen is practically the standard gold coin of other worlds but only half is gold, while the othe half of the metal is copper or brass mixed in.

Have Fun!
